pr_title: [Rust Server] Bugfix #5948 (Generated client code "Disabled because there's no example")

timeline.bodyText:
Can you explain this logic?
If there's an optional parameter, if it's been provided, we can still provide an example if one has been given?
timeline.author: richardwhiuk

replies.bodyText:
Yes. You can provide example, and all will be ok.
The issue is current example code will choose a value for the parameter. If it is optional, it will give None directly, but if required, it can only use the codegenParameter.example value.
So if we set codegenParameter.example null with required, the example will get problem in generating.
replies.author: paladinzh

timeline.message: [Rust Server] Add test case yaml with "Disabled because there's no example" issue.
[Rust Server] Fix RustServerCodegen type: object example "Disabled because there's no example" issue.
[Rust Server] Fix example-client-main param.example character escaping issue with raw string.
[Rust Server] Add test case yaml new generated code after fix.
[Rust Server] Add test case yaml new generated code after fix.
